title: Is Australia Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde when it comes to clean energy? | ABC NEWS
description: Renewable energy accounts for around 40 percent of Australia's energy grid, with the federal government targeting a doubling of this within five years.  However, fossil fuel exports are still on the rise, as reported by ABC's Alan Kohler. title: Pilot dead after two light planes collide in Sydney's south-west | ABC NEWS
description: A pilot has died after two light planes collided in mid-air in Sydney's south-west. Emergency services were called to Napper Field in Wedderburn around 11:50 am. One of the planes crashed into nearby bushland, where the pilot's body was located. title: Fears NT could become â€˜dumping groundâ€™ for climate pollution under CO2 plan | ABC NEWS
description: The Northern Territory government has ambitions for Darwin to become a global hub for storing liquid carbon dioxide from developments across Asia.  It's a move some experts say could create a lucrative new industry, helping other countries meet their climate goals, while environment groups say it will turn Darwin into a dumping ground for emissions. Roxanne Fitzgerald has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: At least 32 people charged during port blockade in NSW | ABC NEWS
description: NSW police have arrested more than 140 people for trying to block the shipping channel in Newcastle Harbour. title: Two firefighters injured fighting factory inferno in NSW | ABC NEWS
description: A massive fireball has sent a chemical tank into the air, raining concrete down on crews fighting a fierce blaze in western Sydney. Two firefighters were injured in the Saturday night blaze, which the fire commissioner called a "miracle."  An investigation into the fire's cause is underway, involving fire investigators, NSW Police, and the environmental agency. title: Can Australia become the world's 'cleaner' rare earth refiner? | ABC NEWS
description: Australia holds a plethora of rare earths â€” minerals essential for all sorts of cutting-edge technologies from wind turbines to hypersonic missiles.  Until now, most of them have been sent to be refined in China.  But after last month's signing a $13 billion critical minerals deal with the US to boost production and refining, Australia must deal with some significant environmental challenges â€” mostly around water. title: Survivors of forced adoption in South Australia call for greater recognition | ABC NEWS
description: Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.  Survivors of historical forced adoption practices are calling for South Australia to establish a state-based redress scheme.   Tasmania recently became the second state, after Victoria, to announce such an initiative.   The SA government says it remains committed to supporting those affected, but declined to say whether it will establish a redress scheme in the future.
